info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 1:33PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Fulton, southern Herkimer and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 133 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Newport, or 10 miles north of Herkimer, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Falls, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Newport, Stratford, Middleville, Cold Brook, Oppenheim, Fairfield, Norway, Ingham Mills, Curtis, Farrel Corner, Countryman, Lotville, Rasbach Corner, Knappville, Burrell Corners, Mindenville and Kelhi Corners. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 29A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
